name: 🌯Whole Grain Wrap
ingredients: ½ cup cooked quinoa or brown rice
steps: Lay out the whole grain tortilla on a clean surface.
Spread hummus or Greek yogurt evenly over the wrap.
Add cooked quinoa or brown rice in a line down the center.
Layer grated carrots, cucumber slices, and spinach leaves on top.
Drizzle olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Carefully roll the wrap tightly.
Slice diagonally and serve fresh.

name: 🎃Spongy Pumpkin Bread
ingredients: 1 ¾ cups whole wheat flour (or all-purpose flour)
1 cup pumpkin purée (fresh or canned, unsweetened)
½ cup olive oil (or melted coconut oil)
steps: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease and flour a loaf pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together pumpkin purée, eggs, oil, honey, milk, and vanilla until smooth.
In another bowl, mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and salt.
Slowly fold the dry ingredients into the wet mixture. Stir until just combined (don’t overmix).
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 50–60 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let it cool for 10–15 minutes before slicing...

name: 🌿Kola Kada
ingredients: ¼ cup red rice (washed and soaked)
1 tsp herbal mix (Gotukola, Welpenela, or any local leafy greens)
steps: Wash and soak the red rice for at least 30 minutes.
Boil 1 liter of water in a pot.
Add the soaked rice and cook on medium heat until soft.
Blend or pound the herbal leaves into a fine paste.
Add the herbal paste to the rice porridge.
Stir well and simmer for 5–10 minutes.
Add salt, coconut milk, or sweetener if desired.
Serve hot.

name: 🌾Coconut & Mango Brown Rice
ingredients: Fresh mint or shredded coconut for garnish (optional)
steps: Rinse brown rice under cold water.
In a saucepan, add rice, coconut milk, water, and salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 35–40 minutes until rice is tender and liquid absorbed.
Dice ripe mango into small cubes.
Once rice is cooked, fluff with a fork.
Stir in coconut oil and honey/maple syrup (if using).
Stir in coconut oil and honey/maple syrup (if using).
Garnish with mint leaves or shredded coconut.

name: 🍣Maki Sushi
ingredients: Soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger (for serving)
steps: Rinse sushi rice well until water runs clear.
Cook with water (rice cooker or pot).
Once cooked, mix gently with rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. Let cool to room temp.
Place a nori sheet (shiny side down) on a bamboo mat (or a clean towel wrapped in cling film).
With wet hands, spread a thin, even layer of rice over ⅔ of the nori sheet.
Lay cucumber, carrot, and avocado in a line across the bottom third.
Roll tightly using the bamboo mat, sealing the edge with a little water.
Cut into 6 pieces with a sharp, wet knife.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

name: 🐟Spicy Brown Rice with Grilled Fish
ingredients: 2 medium fish fillets (salmon, tuna, or any white fish)
Fresh herbs (parsley, dill, or coriander) for garnish
steps: Rinse rice and cook with water/broth until tender (35–40 minutes).
Mix olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Brush over fish fillets and let sit for 10–15 mins.
Heat a grill pan or outdoor grill.
Cook fish for 3–4 minutes per side until cooked through and lightly charred.
Place a scoop of brown rice on the plate.
Top with grilled fish.
Add steamed veggies and garnish with herbs.

name: 🍝Kale Pesto Pasta
ingredients: 2 cups fresh kale leaves (washed, stems removed)
½ cup fresh basil (optional, for extra flavor)
¼ cup Parmesan cheese (or nutritional yeast for vegan)
steps: Boil pasta in salted water until al dente. Reserve ½ cup pasta water.
In a blender/food processor, add kale, walnuts, garlic, Parmesan, lemon juice, and olive oil.
Blend until smooth, adding a splash of pasta water if needed.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss cooked pasta with kale pesto.
Adjust consistency with reserved pasta water.
Top with extra Parmesan, walnuts, or a drizzle of olive oil.

name: 😋Stuffed Bell Peppers With Quinoa, Beans & Herbs
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color, tops cut, seeds removed)
1 cup cooked beans (black beans, kidney, or chickpeas)
½ cup shredded cheese (optional topping, or vegan cheese/nutritional yeast)
steps: Rinse quinoa, then cook with vegetable broth until fluffy (~15 minutes).
Heat olive oil in a pan, sauté onion & garlic until golden.
Add beans, cooked quinoa, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Mix in fresh herbs.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Fill each bell pepper with the quinoa-bean mixture.
Top with cheese if desired.
Place peppers upright in a baking dish, cover with foil.
Bake for 25–30 minutes (last 5 minutes uncovered if using cheese).
Garnish with extra herbs and serve warm with a side salad.

name: 🍛Eggplant Lasagna
steps: Slice eggplants, sprinkle lightly with salt, and let sit 15 mins (removes excess moisture & bitterness).
Pat dry with a paper towel.
Brush with olive oil and roast/grill slices for ~10 minutes until tender.
In a bowl, combine ricotta, egg (if using), half the Parmesan, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Spread a thin layer of marinara in a baking dish.
Add a layer of eggplant slices → ricotta mixture → marinara → mozzarella.
Repeat layers until ingredients are used up.
Finish with mozzarella + Parmesan on top.
Cover with foil and bake 25 minutes.
Remove foil, bake another 10–15 minutes until golden and bubbly.
Let rest 5–10 minutes before slicing.
Garnish with fresh basil.

name: 🍪Healthy Oatmeal Cookies
ingredients: ¾ cup whole wheat flour (or almond flour for GF)
⅓ cup coconut oil (melted) or olive oil
⅓ cup honey or maple syrup
1 egg (or flax egg for vegan: 1 tbsp flaxseed + 3 tbsp water)
½ cup raisins or dark chocolate chips (optional)
¼ cup chopped nuts (walnuts, almonds, or pecans – optional)
steps: In a bowl, combine oats, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk oil, honey/maple syrup, egg, and vanilla.
Add dry mixture to wet, stir until just combined.
Fold in raisins/chocolate chips and nuts (if using).
Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
Scoop dough into 12 balls, flatten slightly.

name: 🎂🍰Soft Carrot Cake
ingredients: 1 ½ cups whole wheat flour (or all-purpose)
½ cup olive oil or melted coconut oil
½ cup honey or maple syrup (or brown sugar)
½ cup crushed pineapple (drained, optional – adds moisture)
¼ cup chopped walnuts or pecans (optional)
steps: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease and line a round cake tin.
In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, oil, honey/maple syrup, and vanilla.
Add grated carrots (and pineapple if using).
Fold wet mix into dry ingredients until just combined. Stir in nuts if desired.
Pour batter into tin.
Bake 30–35 minutes, until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let cool completely before frosting.
Beat cream cheese with honey and vanilla until smooth.
Spread over cooled cake.

name: 🍫Healty Rockey Roadbars
ingredients: 1 ½ cups rolled oats (or crushed whole-grain biscuits)
½ cup nut butter (peanut, almond, or cashew)
¼ cup honey or maple syrup
½ cup dark chocolate chips (70% cocoa, melted)
½ cup mini marshmallows (or sugar-free alternative)
¼ cup chopped nuts (almonds, walnuts, or hazelnuts)
¼ cup dried fruit (cranberries, raisins, or cherries)
steps: In a saucepan, melt nut butter, honey, and coconut oil until smooth.
Stir in cocoa powder and a pinch of salt.
In a large bowl, combine oats, melted chocolate, nuts, dried fruit, and marshmallows.
Pour the wet mixture over and mix well.
Line a square baking dish with parchment paper.
Press mixture firmly into the dish.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours (or freeze 30 mins) until firm.
Slice into bars. Store in fridge (lasts ~1 week).
